snippet: Deductibles and other out-of-pocket costs on plans bought through the government are much higher than the typical employer-sponsored policy.
abstract: Consumers are finding as they delve into details of health insurance exchanges that, although premiums may be lower, deductibles and other out-of-pocket costs on insurance plans bought through the government are often much higher that what is typical with employer-sponsored plans.
lead_paragraph: Deductibles and other out-of-pocket costs on plans bought through the government are much higher than the typical employer-sponsored policy.

headline.main: On Health Exchanges, Premiums May Be Low, but Other Costs Can Be High
headline.print_headline: On Health Exchanges, Premiums May Be Low, but Other Costs Can Be High

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
